hints.content:
The number line shows $\maroonD{10}$ equal jumps of $\blueD{3}$ units.

![The same number line with each arrow labeled, plus 3](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/deb1df791fbca09de0b985fb3dd0a095c969f410)

options.explanation:
We can reach the same total using $\blueD{3}$ equal jumps of $\maroonD{10}$ units.

![A number line labeled 0, 10, 20, 30. Arrows labeled, plus 10, point right from each number to the next.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/80bfb0709d9610a059c019aab0695c3b4324cacc)

$\blueD{3} \times \maroonD{10} = \underbrace{\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}}_{\blueD{3}\maroonD{\text{ tens}}}=\greenD{30}$

So $\maroonD{10}\times\blueD{3}=\greenD{30}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the number line below to help solve the equation.* 

$10 \times 3 = $ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]
